|action3=GTC |action3date=17:32, 16 March 2014 (UTC) |action3link=Wikipedia:Featured topic candidates/Light cruisers of Germany/archive1 |action3result=promoted
|ftname=Light cruisers of Germany
|dykdate=24 November 2011 |dykentry=... that on the first day of [[World War I]], the German [[light cruiser]] '''[[SMS Breslau|SMS ''Breslau'']]''' ''(pictured)'' bombarded the port of [[Annaba|Bône]] in [[French Algeria|French North Africa]]? |currentstatus=GA |topic=war }} {{Talk header}} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Ships|class=GA|B1=y|B2=y|B3=y|B4=y|B5=y}} {{WPMILHIST|class=GA|B1=y|B2=y|B3=y|B4=y|B5=y|German= yes|Maritime=yes|WWI-=yes}} {{WikiProject Germany| class=GA| importance = Low | B-Class-1 = yes | B-Class-2 = yes | B-Class-3 = yes | B-Class-4 = yes | B-Class-5 = yes}} {{WikiProject Shipwrecks|class=GA|importance =mid}} }} ==Discrepancies between sources== That little non-action on 27 Feb 1916 isn't mentioned in Langensiepen & Güleryüz; they just refer to carrying troops to Trebizond and oil to Sinope. I'll have to see if Nekrasov has anything about it.--[[User:Sturmvogel 66|Sturmvogel 66]] ([[User talk:Sturmvogel 66|talk]]) 17:47, 5 November 2011 (UTC) :OK, done with L & G; I've added their information in Notes. Now to dig up Nekrasov and see what he has to say. I redid the lede; lemme know what you think.--[[User:Sturmvogel 66|Sturmvogel 66]] ([[User talk:Sturmvogel 66|talk]]) 19:17, 7 November 2011 (UTC) ::That looks fine to me - the lead I wrote was more of a placeholder than anything. [[User:Parsecboy|Parsecboy]] ([[User talk:Parsecboy|talk]]) 23:58, 7 November 2011 (UTC)
